main event: On April 19, 1952, radar operators reported observing three aircraft flying in formation over Benton, Pennsylvania.
interesting points: The objects were tracked for 28 minutes before being identified as friendly aircraft., The radar operators observed the target at an altitude of approximately 12,000 feet., The sighting was initially recorded on March 29, 1952, although the report date is April 19, 1952., The aircraft were traveling in an easterly direction., No immediate tactical significance was noted for the sighting.
